ANU.name: Gary Toone
ANU.colleges: College of Arts and Social Sciences
expertise: Multicultural Intercultural And Cross Cultural Studies
Aboriginal And Torres Strait Islander Cultural Studies
Aboriginal And Torres Strait Islander Archaeology
interest: Gary's research interests lie in the area of cultural heritage, with a focus on Australian Aboriginal cultures. The scope of his experience and research is wide and interdisciplinary; extending from cultural heritage theory (significance, identity and memory) and cultural resources (tangible and intangible cultural resources, archaeology and museum curatorship) to cultural heritage governance (policy, practice and management). He is particularly interested in the positioning of Aboriginal cultural resources and heritage within a multicultural Australia and the theoretical and practical issues associated with cross-cultural cultural resource management.

publication.title: book review)
publication.source: Nharangga Wargunni Bugi-Buggillu: A journey through Narungga history'Australian Aboriginal Studies, no. 1, pp. 109-110
